Comments_List: You learn elementary polish. it's great.
I developed crucial language skills, including reading, writing, listening, and speaking skills.

I immensely improved my ability to hold a conversation in Polish on a variety of topics. At the end of year Polish gathering, I was able to speak to some real Poles and have a decently complex conversation!
We learned about Polish vocabulary, grammar, and culture.
A little bit more warning before the quizzes.

The professor is the kindest person ever and is incredibly passionate. That being said, you get what you put in. The course structures is a bit lax, so you could skate by without doing much work. But, if you are committed to learning the language and putting in the time and effort, you will learn a lot.
This was a wonderful class and could not be improved!
This course is great! I had a fun time in class and learned a good amount of Polish.
Loved how small the class size was. It made learning and asking questions much more comfortable.
If you're looking for a fun and exciting language to take, this is it. TAKE THIS CLASS. Krystyna made coming to class everyday fun and enjoyable. THIS IS THE BEST CLASS IVE TAKEN AT YALE.

Yes. Krystyna is absolutely amazing and Polish is an amazing language. The class is not difficult (although the Polish language is) and is so much fun. You'll develop a really close relationship with Krystyna and your classmates because there are so few people who take the course.

Yes, I would highly recommend this class. It has been so much fun and I have learned so much. Krystyna is truly the kindest professor who cares so much about teaching- an often rare attribute among Yale professors.
Absolutely, Polish is a great language and the class is usually so small that everyone gets much more attention than they would in a different language class.
